lead_paragraph: Shaping the Coalition U.S.-PAKISTANI RELATIONS -- President Pervez Musharraf said he would ask President Bush for concrete ''gestures'' in response to Pakistan's strong support in the war on terror, including the release of American F-16 fighters withheld because of Pakistan's development of nuclear weapons. General Musharraf and President Bush are scheduled to meet today in New York. A1 IRAN'S LEADER -- President Mohammad Khatami of Iran, in his first interview with an American publication since assuming the presidency in 1997, branded as extremist Osama bin Laden's version of Islam and said it did not represent the majority of the world's 1.2 billion Muslims. A1
